summary: This is an email chain from July 7, 2019, between FBI supervisors praising the team that executed the arrest and search of Jeffrey Epstein. It details the overnight operation, the discovery of crucial evidence including a safe, and efforts to keep the case out of the media. The email highlights inter-agency cooperation and the beginning of a long investigation.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the forwarding email, praising the squad for their work on the Epstein arrest and search operation.

persons.name: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: The original sender of the thank-you email, commending the entire team for their professionalism and resilience during the Epstein arrest and search operations.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Mentioned as being called in the middle of the night to provide legal support during the search operation.

connections.person2: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
connections.description: Both are FBI supervisors involved in overseeing the Epstein arrest and search operation, with SSA forwarding ASAC's thank-you message.

connections.person1: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
connections.description: The ASAC mentions calling an AUSA in the middle of the night for legal support during the search operation, indicating a working relationship.

events.title: Arrest and Search of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: FBI and task force executed the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and a search operation at his property, working from late evening until early morning.

events.title: Discovery of Crucial Evidence
events.description: During the search, a safe was opened leading to the discovery of crucial evidence, which is expected to lead to more search warrants and possible seizure of Epstein's computers.

keyFacts: The arrest and search of Jeffrey Epstein was executed by a dedicated FBI/task force team that worked overnight from July 6 into the early morning of July 7, 2019.
A crucial piece of evidence was discovered when the team successfully opened a safe during the search, which is expected to lead to further warrants and computer seizures.
The team successfully kept the Epstein case out of the media for six months prior to the arrest, which was instrumental to the investigation.
The operation required calling an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) in the middle of the night for legal support, indicating the high-priority, round-the-clock nature of the work.
The email frames the operation as the beginning of a long effort to find and give a voice to dozens of victims of child exploitation.
